html:
ACADEMIC CONDUCT TRAINING

Welcome to this essential online training module on Academic Conduct. Whether you’re just starting your academic journey or looking to refine your skills, this course is designed to equip you with the knowledge and tools to succeed ethically and effectively in your studies. Academic integrity is the cornerstone of university life, it ensures fairness, builds trust, and prepares you for a future where credibility and originality matter.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Understand Academic Research: Learn what qualifies as academic research, why it’s vital to your success, and how to conduct it effectively.

+  Evaluate Sources Critically: Master the ability to assess the credibility of sources using clear, practical criteria.

+  Practice Ethical Writing: Develop skills in paraphrasing and citing sources to avoid plagiarism and present your work authentically.

+  Recognize Academic Misconduct: Identify different forms of academic misconduct and understand their consequences.

+  Navigate Procedures: Gain insight into the university’s processes for addressing poor academic practice and misconduct, including how to respond if faced with allegations.

+  Apply Knowledge Practically: Use interactive exercises to reinforce your understanding and apply these principles to real academic scenarios.

Module Content:
